tit.j: マキノトーキー製作所
tit.cmt: Seisakusho を Seisaku-jo に修正しました。

sen.j: マキノトーキー製作所（-せいさくしょ、1935年11月 設立 - 1937年4月 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Makino Talkie Seisakusho (established in November 1935, liquidated in April 1937) was an movie company that once existed in Kyoto.
Makino Talkie Seisaku-jo (established in November 1935, liquidated in April 1937) was a film company that once existed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Seisakusho を Seisaku-jo に修正しました。an movie を a film に修正しました。
sen.e: Makino Talkie Seisaku-jo (established in November 1935, liquidated in April 1937) was a film company that once existed in Kyoto.

sen.j: 当時27歳の映画監督マキノ雅弘が、自ら開発した録音機材を投入して設立した初期のトーキー映画のプロダクションである。
sen.e: It was a company which then 27-year-old film director Masahiro MAKINO established in order to produce talkie films by using a recorder developed by himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It was a production company of talkie movies in early times established by Masahiro MAKINO, who was then 27-year-old film director in order to produce talkie films with a recorder developed by himself.
sen.cmt: 「初期のトーキー」訳漏れのため、全文修正して対応しました。
sen.e: It was a production company of talkie movies in early times established by Masahiro MAKINO, who was then 27-year-old film director in order to produce talkie films with a recorder developed by himself.

sen.j: 1936年9月に組織変更しマキノトーキー株式会社となったが、短命に終わった。
sen.e: It became Makino Talkie Co., Ltd. in September 1936, but its life was short.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It became Makino Talkie Co., Ltd. in September 1936, but its life was short.
It became Makino Talkie Co., Ltd. in September 1936, but its life was short.

tit.j: 前史 技術開発者マキノ
tit.cmt: Prehistory : を Prehistory: に修正しました。

sen.j: マキノの父・牧野省三は早くからトーキーに取り組んでおり、マキノ・プロダクション時代の1929年（昭和4年）にはディスク式トーキー作品『戻橋』（監督マキノ正博）を製作、全国的なヒットを生んだ。
sen.e: Makino's father Shozo MAKINO was engaged in the production of talkie films earlier on, and "Modoribashi" (directed by Masahiro Makino), a disk-type talkie film produced by Makino Production in 1929, became a nationwide hit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Makino's father Shozo MAKINO was engaged in the production of talkie films earlier on, and "Modoribashi" (directed by Masahiro MAKINO), a disk-type talkie film produced by Makino Production in 1929, became a nationwide hit.
sen.cmt: Masahiro Makino を Masahiro MAKINO に修正しました。
sen.e: Makino's father Shozo MAKINO was engaged in the production of talkie films earlier on, and "Modoribashi" (directed by Masahiro MAKINO), a disk-type talkie film produced by Makino Production in 1929, became a nationwide hit.

sen.j: しかし、興行の現場では映写技師がシンクロに苦労し、苦情が殺到していた。
sen.e: At movie theaters, however, projectionists faced a difficulty in synchronizing and a lot of complaints were made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: At movie theaters, however, projectionists faced a difficulty in synchronizing and a lot of complaints were made.
At movie theaters, however, projectionists faced a difficulty in synchronizing and a lot of complaints were made.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）に松竹が「国産初のトーキー映画」とされる『マダムと女房』（監督五所平之助）を発表。
sen.e: In 1931, Shochiku released "Madamu to Nyobo" (directed by Heinosuke GOSHO), which is regarded as "the nation's first talkie film".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In 1931, Shochiku released "Madam to Nyobo" (directed by Heinosuke GOSHO), which is regarded as 'the nation's first talkie film.'
sen.cmt: Madamu を Madam に修正しました。"the nation's first talkie film". を'the nation's first talkie film.' に修正しました。
sen.e: In 1931, Shochiku released "Madam to Nyobo" (directed by Heinosuke GOSHO), which is regarded as 'the nation's first talkie film.'

sen.j: 翌1932年（昭和7年）から松竹、日活、月形陽候プロダクション、片岡千恵蔵プロダクション、新興キネマ、新映画社、音映の各社が数本ずつのオール・トーキー、サイレント映画にトーキー部分を織り込んだパート・トーキー、サイレントに音楽や活弁を収録したサウンド版を製作しはじめた。
sen.e: From 1932, Shochiku, Nikkatsu, Tsukigata Yoko Production, Kataoka Chiezo Production, Shinko Kinema, Shin Eigasha and Onei began to produce all-talkie films, part-talkie films which incorporated talkie part into silent films and sound films which incorporated music and katsuben (silent film narration) into silent films.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理 オール・トーキー、パート・トーキー、サウンド版→定訳不明
sen.e: From 1932, Shochiku, Nikkatsu, Tsukigata Yoko Production, Kataoka Chiezo Production, Shinko Kinema, Shin Eigasha and Onei began to produce all-talkie films, part-talkie films which incorporated talkie part into silent films and sound films which incorporated music and katsuben (silent film narration) into silent films.

From 1932, Shochiku, Nikkatsu, Tsukigata Yoko Production, Kataoka Chiezo Production, Shinko Kinema, Shin Eigasha and Onei began to produce all-talkie films, part-talkie films which incorporated talkie part into silent films and sound films which incorporated music and katsuben (silent film narration) into silent films.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年）、マキノ正博は、亡くなった父・省三の代からの横田永之助との確執から日活を馘首された。
sen.e: Masahiro MAKINO was dismissed by Nikkatsu in 1933 because of the feud with Einosuke YOKOTA, which had lasted since the time of his late father Shozo.
Masahiro MAKINO was dismissed by Nikkatsu in 1933 because of the feud with Einosuke YOKOTA, which had lasted since the time of his late father Shozo.
Masahiro MAKINO was dismissed by Nikkatsu in 1933 because of the feud with Einosuke YOKOTA, which had lasted since the time of his late father Shozo.

sen.j: これからはトーキーだと確信していたマキノは、退職金の2,000円（当時）の半分を握って上京した。
sen.e: Makino who believed in the arrival of the era of talkie went to Tokyo with a half of his retirement allowance 2000 yen (at the time) in pockets.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Makino who believed in the arrival of the era of talkie went to Tokyo with a half of his retirement allowance 2000 yen (at the time) in pockets.
Makino who believed in the arrival of the era of talkie went to Tokyo with a half of his retirement allowance 2000 yen (at the time) in pockets.

sen.j: 日本国粋会の太田進一率いる牛込区神楽坂（現在の新宿区神楽坂）の音映で、同社の技術スタッフたちとともに録音・撮影機材の研究・開発に没頭した。
sen.e: He concentrated together with his colleagues in the research and development of recorders and cinema cameras at Onei, which was located in Kagurazaka, Ushigome Ward (current Kagurazaka Shinjuku Ward) and was led by Shinichi OTA of Nihon Kokusuikai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He concentrated together with his colleagues in the research and development of recorders and cinema cameras at Onei, which was located in Kagurazaka, Ushigome Ward (current Kagurazaka, Shinjuku Ward) and was led by Shinichi OTA of Nihon Kokusuikai.
sen.cmt: Kagurazaka Shinjuku を Kagurazaka, Shinjuku に修正しました。
sen.e: He concentrated together with his colleagues in the research and development of recorders and cinema cameras at Onei, which was located in Kagurazaka, Ushigome Ward (current Kagurazaka, Shinjuku Ward) and was led by Shinichi OTA of Nihon Kokusuikai.

sen.j: 新機材を開発したマキノは、音映の京都支社を新設して、録音技師として各社の下請けをし、録音技術の研鑽を積んだ。
sen.e: After developed new machines, Makino established Kyoto branch of Onei, worked for other companies as a recording engineer and devoted himself to the study of recording technology.
After developing new machines, Makino established Kyoto branch of Onei, worked for other companies as a recording engineer and devoted himself to the study of recording technology.
sen.cmt: developed を developing に修正しました。
sen.e: After developing new machines, Makino established Kyoto branch of Onei, worked for other companies as a recording engineer and devoted himself to the study of recording technology.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）、神戸市の千鳥興業の専務取締役宗田政雄が京都のマキノを訪れ、「月間トーキー2本、サウンド版2本、年間48プログラム」の生産ペースを前提に、配給と製作費の出資をする旨の申し入れをした。
sen.e: In 1935, Masao MUNETA, a senior managing director of Chidori Kogyo in Kobe City, visited Kyoto to see Makino and expressed his intention to invest in the production and distribution of "two talkie films a month, two sound films a month and annual aggregate of 48 films".

In 1935, Masao MUNETA, a senior managing director of Chidori Kogyo in Kobe City, visited Kyoto to see Makino and expressed his intention to invest in the production and distribution of 'two talkie films a month, two sound films a month and annual aggregate of 48 films.'
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: In 1935, Masao MUNETA, a senior managing director of Chidori Kogyo in Kobe City, visited Kyoto to see Makino and expressed his intention to invest in the production and distribution of 'two talkie films a month, two sound films a month and annual aggregate of 48 films.'

sen.j: ついては12月中旬から第1作を公開したいので、11月からクランクインしてほしいということだった。
sen.e: He also requested to start filming from November since he wanted to show the first film from the middle of December.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He also requested to start filming from November since he wanted to show the first film from the middle of December.
He also requested to start filming from November since he wanted to show the first film from the middle of December.

sen.j: この申し入れに、マキノは考え込んだが、笹井末三郎が撮影所用地を調達して励まし、マキノはついに新会社設立の決意をした。
sen.e: After racking out his brain over the proposal, Makino finally made up his mind to establish a new company since Suesaburo SASAI encouraged him by providing a land for studio.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After racking out his brain over the proposal, Makino finally made up his mind to establish a new company since Suesaburo SASAI encouraged him by providing a land for studio.
After racking out his brain over the proposal, Makino finally made up his mind to establish a new company since Suesaburo SASAI encouraged him by providing a land for studio.

tit.j: 安価なトーキーの量産

sen.j: 同年11月に設立に先駆け、10月末には設立の発表がなされた。
sen.e: The establishment of the company was publicized at the end of October prior to the establishment scheduled in November.
The establishment of the company was publicized at the end of October prior to the establishment scheduled in November.
The establishment of the company was publicized at the end of October prior to the establishment scheduled in November.

sen.j: 第1回作品は澤村國太郎と原駒子の主演、マキノ監督によるトーキー映画『江戸噺鼠小僧』であった。
sen.e: The first film was a talkie film "Edo Banashi Nezumi Kozo" staring Kunitaro SAWAMURA and Komako HARA and it was directed by Makino.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The first film was a talkie film "Edo Banashi Nezumi Kozo" staring Kunitaro SAWAMURA and Komako HARA and it was directed by Makino.
The first film was a talkie film "Edo Banashi Nezumi Kozo" staring Kunitaro SAWAMURA and Komako HARA and it was directed by Makino.

sen.j: 撮影所が建設中のため、新興キネマ京都撮影所のステージを借りて撮影を行ない、同年12月18日に公開された。
sen.e: It was filmed at Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio since the new studio was under construction, and it was released on December 18 of the year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It was filmed at Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio since the new studio was under construction, and it was released on December 18 of the year.
It was filmed at Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio since the new studio was under construction, and it was released on December 18 of the year.

sen.j: 同年12月末、太秦帷子ヶ辻中開町（現在の右京区太秦堀ヶ内町）にマキノトーキー撮影所が開設となった。
sen.e: Makino Talkie Studio was established in Uzumasa Katabiranotsuji Nakahiraki-cho (current Uzumasa Horinouchi-cho, Ukyo Ward) at the end of December.
Makino Talkie Studio was established in Uzumasa Katabiranotsuji Nakahiraki-cho (current Uzumasa Horinouchi-cho, Ukyo Ward) at the end of December.
Makino Talkie Studio was established in Uzumasa Katabiranotsuji Nakahiraki-cho (current Uzumasa Horinouchi-cho, Ukyo Ward) at the end of December.

sen.j: 撮影所が開所してわずか1か月の同月末、すでに通算9本を完成、4本の映画にとりかかっていた。
sen.e: At the end of the month, only one month after the establishment of the studio, the company had already produced nine films and had started to produce another four films.
At the end of the month, only one month after the establishment of the studio, the company had already produced nine films and had started to produce another four films.
At the end of the month, only one month after the establishment of the studio, the company had already produced nine films and had started to produce another four films.

sen.j: やがてサウンド版はやめ、安価なトーキーを月間4本ペースで製作した。
sen.e: The company ceased the production of sound films before long and produced inexpensive talkie films at a pace of four films per month.
The company ceased the production of sound films before long and produced inexpensive talkie films at a pace of four films per month.
The company ceased the production of sound films before long and produced inexpensive talkie films at a pace of four films per month.

sen.j: しかし、新興キネマから東宝へ移籍した森田信義プロデューサーからの要請で、同年4月に月形を東宝にレンタルしたところ、帰ってこなかった。
sen.e: The company rented Tsukigata in April of the year in response to the request of Nobuyoshi MORITA, a producer who had been transferred from Shinko Kinema to Toho, but he never returned to the company.
The company rented Tsukigata in April of the year in response to the request of Nobuyoshi MORITA, a producer who had been transferred from Shinko Kinema to Toho, but he never returned to the company.
The company rented Tsukigata in April of the year in response to the request of Nobuyoshi MORITA, a producer who had been transferred from Shinko Kinema to Toho, but he never returned to the company.

sen.j: 森田は、マキノトーキー第1作を「山本正夫」名義で書いた人物である。
sen.e: Morita was a person who wrote, under the name of "Masao YAMAMOTO", the scenario of the first film of Makino Talkie.
Morita was the one who wrote the scenario of the first film for Makino Talkie under the name of "Masao YAMAMOTO."
sen.cmt: 語順を入れ替えて全文修正しました。
sen.e: Morita was the one who wrote the scenario of the first film for Makino Talkie under the name of "Masao YAMAMOTO."

sen.j: また同じ時期、吉本興業の林弘高の紹介で東宝の滝村和男に数日間、トーキーを学ぶ名目で撮影所に出入りさせた。
sen.e: Around that time, the company allowed, on referral from Hirotaka HAYASHI of Yoshimoto Kogyo, Kazuo TAKIMURA of Toho to enter the studio for a few days under the guise of learning about talkie.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Around that time, the company allowed, on referral from Hirotaka HAYASHI of Yoshimoto Kogyo, Kazuo TAKIMURA of Toho to enter the studio for a few days under the guise of learning about talkie.
Around that time, the company allowed, on referral from Hirotaka HAYASHI of Yoshimoto Kogyo, Kazuo TAKIMURA of Toho to enter the studio for a few days under the guise of learning about talkie.

sen.j: ところが、『涯なき航路』の富士でのロケ先に滝村が現れ、中野英治や山縣直代ら数人を引き抜き、東京へ連れて行かれてしまう。
sen.e: However, Takimura appeared at the location of "Hatenaki Koro" in Fuji, enticed several persons including Hideharu NAKANO and Naoyo YAMAGATA and brought them to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, Takimura appeared at the location of "Hatenaki Koro" in Fuji, enticed several persons including Hideharu NAKANO and Naoyo YAMAGATA and brought them to Tokyo.
However, Takimura appeared at the location of "Hatenaki Koro" in Fuji, enticed several persons including Hideharu NAKANO and Naoyo YAMAGATA and brought them to Tokyo.

sen.j: 東京の映音の太田進一社長、マキノトーキー理事の笹井末三郎、千鳥興業の宗田政雄、マキノトーキー企画部長の松山英夫、所長のマキノの首脳会議により、株式会社化を決議、同年9月、組織変更を行ない、同社は「マキノトーキー株式会社」となる。
sen.e: The company was reorganized into "Makino Talkie Company Ltd." in September of the year in accordance with the resolution made at the top-level meeting, in which Shinichi OTA, the president of Eion in Tokyo, Suesaburo SASAI, a director of Makino Talkie, Masao MUNETA of Chidori Kogyo, Hideo MATSUYAMA, manager of planning department of Makino Talkie, and Makino, the head of studio, participated.

The company was reorganized into 'Makino Talkie Company Ltd.' in September of the year in accordance with the resolution made at the top-level meeting, in which Shinichi OTA, the president of Eion in Tokyo, Suesaburo SASAI, a director of Makino Talkie, Masao MUNETA of Chidori Kogyo, Hideo MATSUYAMA, manager of planning department of Makino Talkie, and Makino, the head of studio, participated.
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: The company was reorganized into 'Makino Talkie Company Ltd.' in September of the year in accordance with the resolution made at the top-level meeting, in which Shinichi OTA, the president of Eion in Tokyo, Suesaburo SASAI, a director of Makino Talkie, Masao MUNETA of Chidori Kogyo, Hideo MATSUYAMA, manager of planning department of Makino Talkie, and Makino, the head of studio, participated.

sen.j: 同時期の前年末以来の通算生産本数は、オール・トーキー26本、パート・トーキー2本、サウンド版2本であり、総製作費の千鳥興業のマキノトーキーへの支払額が40万5,000円、マキノトーキーの立替額が45万円であった。
sen.e: By that time, the company had produced 26 all-talkie films, two part-talkie films and two sound films, and as for their production cost, Chidori Kogyo had payed 405,000 yen to Makino Talkie and the balance of advance payment made by Makino Talkie was 450,000 yen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: By that time, the company had produced 26 all-talkie films, two part-talkie films and two sound films, and as for their production cost, Chidori Kogyo had paid 405,000 yen to Makino Talkie and the balance of advance payment made by Makino Talkie was 450,000 yen.
sen.cmt: payed を paid に修正しました。
sen.e: By that time, the company had produced 26 all-talkie films, two part-talkie films and two sound films, and as for their production cost, Chidori Kogyo had paid 405,000 yen to Makino Talkie and the balance of advance payment made by Makino Talkie was 450,000 yen.

sen.j: その精算を行ない、千鳥とマキノで資本金を折半し、撮影所と千鳥興業配給とその神戸事務所を株式会社化したのであった。
sen.e: Under such situation, Chidori and Makino cleared off the above balance, shared the capital and converted into a joint-stock company including the studio, Chidori Kogyo's distribution and its Kobe office.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Under such situation, Chidori and Makino cleared off the above balance, shared the capital and converted into a joint-stock company including the studio, Chidori Kogyo's distribution and its Kobe office.

Under such situation, Chidori and Makino cleared off the above balance, shared the capital and converted into a joint-stock company including the studio, Chidori Kogyo's distribution and its Kobe office.

sen.j: その後も製作は配給所が負担するという条件が確認された。
sen.e: At the same time, it was confirmed that the production costs be born by the distribution unit as before.
At the same time, it was confirmed that the production costs be born by the distribution unit as before.
At the same time, it was confirmed that the production costs be born by the distribution unit as before.

sen.j: またこの翌月10月1日から、従来千鳥興業が配給していた、西宮の甲陽映画の配給をマキノトーキーが配給することとなった。
sen.e: From October 1, Makino Talkie started to distribute films produced by Koyo Eiga in Nishinomiya in place of Chidori Kogyo.
From October 1, Makino Talkie started to distribute films produced by Koyo Eiga in Nishinomiya in place of Chidori Kogyo.
From October 1, Makino Talkie started to distribute films produced by Koyo Eiga in Nishinomiya in place of Chidori Kogyo.

sen.j: 同年末、株式会社化以降の通算生産本数は、オール・トーキー22本とスペアとしてのサウンド版1本であった。
sen.e: As of the end of the year, aggregate number of films produced after the company became a joint-stock company was 22 talkie films and one sound film.
As of the end of the year, aggregate number of films produced after the company became a joint-stock company was 22 talkie films and one sound film as a spare film.
sen.cmt: 「スペアとして」訳漏れのため as a spare film を追記して対応しました。
sen.e: As of the end of the year, aggregate number of films produced after the company became incorporated was 22 talkie films and one sound film which was taken as a spare film.
sen.cmt: 株式会社化したをwas incorporatedにしました。

sen.j: 笹井が自ら経営する賃貸物件の土地建物を売却して調達した2万円を経理部長の田丸に渡し、全従業員の年末賞与とした。
sen.e: Sasai delivered 20,000 yen, which he secured by selling the land and building he owned for rental business, to the accounting manager Tamaru, and this money was used for the year end bonus for employees.

Sasai delivered 20,000 yen, which he secured by selling the land and building he owned for rental business, to the accounting manager Tamaru, and this money was used for the year end bonus for employees.

Sasai delivered 20,000 yen, which he secured by selling the land and building he owned for rental business, to the accounting manager Tamaru, and this money was used for the year end bonus for employees.

sen.j: 年中無休のマキノトーキーはようやく年末年始休暇をとった。
sen.e: People of Makino Talkie took New Year holidays at last after working without holidays for long.
People of Makino Talkie took New Year holidays at last after working without holidays for long.
People of Makino Talkie took New Year holidays at last after working without holidays for long.

tit.cmt: end を End に修正しました。

sen.j: 1937年（昭和12年）1月8日に千鳥興業の宗田専務が製作費をもって現れたが、製作過剰による千鳥からの資金ショートはなかなか緩和されなかった。
sen.e: Muneta, a senior managing director of Chidori Kogyo, came to the company on January 8, 1937 to pay production expenses, but the company's cash position didn't improve so much due to excessive production.

Muneta, a senior managing director of Chidori Kogyo, came to the company on January 8, 1937 to pay production expenses, but the company's cash position didn't improve so much due to excessive production.

Muneta, a senior managing director of Chidori Kogyo, came to the company on January 8, 1937 to pay production expenses, but the company's cash position didn't improve so much due to excessive production.

sen.j: 同月、350名のアナキズムの大量検挙が行なわれ、笹井は逮捕されなかったが行方不明となった。
sen.e: 350 anarchists were arrested in the same month, and Sasai went missing though he was not arrested.
350 anarchists were arrested in the same month, and Sasai went missing though he was not arrested.
350 anarchists were arrested in the same month, and Sasai went missing though he was not arrested.

sen.j: 同年2月、松竹・日活・新興キネマ・大都映画・マキノトーキーの五社協定を組んで、前年6月設立の「東宝映画配給」をボイコットしようという申し入れをマキノは黙殺した。
sen.e: In February of the same year, Makino ignored the proposal to boycott "Toho Eiga Haikyu", which was established in the previous year, by concluding the agreement among five companies, namely Shochiku, Nikkatsu, Shinko Kinema, Daito Eiga and Makino Talkie.

In February of the same year, Makino ignored the proposal to boycott 'Toho Eiga Haikyu,' which was established in June of the previous year, by concluding the agreement among five companies, namely Shochiku, Nikkatsu, Shinko Kinema, Daito Eiga and Makino Talkie.
sen.cmt: 「6月」訳漏れのため、 "Toho Eiga Haikyu", which was established in the previous year を 'Toho Eiga Haikyu,' which was established in June of the previous year に修正して対応しました。
sen.e: In February of the same year, Makino ignored the proposal to boycott 'Toho Eiga Haikyu,' which was established in June of the previous year, by concluding the agreement among five companies, namely Shochiku, Nikkatsu, Shinko Kinema, Daito Eiga and Makino Talkie.

sen.j: 千鳥興業からの製作資金は6本分でショートした。
sen.e: Funds for production paid by Chidori Kogyo ran out after producing five films.
Funds for production paid by Chidori Kogyo ran out after producing five films.
Funds for production paid by Chidori Kogyo ran out after producing five films.

sen.j: 千鳥興業の財産として、オール・トーキー58本、パート・トーキー2本、サウンド版6本の製作物、撮影所と機材が残った。
sen.e: 58 all-talkie films, two part-talkie films, six sound films as well as the studio and machines remained as the assets of Chidori Kogyo.
58 all-talkie films, two part-talkie films, six sound films as well as the studio and machines remained as the assets of Chidori Kogyo.
58 all-talkie films, two part-talkie films, six sound films as well as the studio and machines remained as the assets of Chidori Kogyo.

sen.j: 製作中のマキノ正博（「牧陶六」名義）監督作『遊侠太平記』はマキノ個人資金で製作、中川信夫監督作『旗本五人男 大江戸の鳶』は松山企画部長が東京で配給権を売却し、これを退職金とした。
sen.e: "Yukyo Taiheiki" directed by Masahiro MAKINO (under the name of Sueroku MAKI), whose filming was under way, was completed by Makino's personal funds, and the planning department manager Matsuyama sold in Tokyo the distribution right of "Hatamoto Goninotoko, Oedo no Tobi" directed by Nobuo NAKAGAWA to pay retirement allowance.

"Yukyo Taiheiki" directed by Masahiro MAKINO (under the name of Sueroku MAKI), whose filming was under way, was completed by Makino's personal funds, and the planning department manager Matsuyama sold the distribution right of "Hatamoto Goninotoko, Oedo no Tobi" directed by Nobuo NAKAGAWA in Tokyo to pay retirement allowance.
sen.cmt: in Tokyo の位置を修正しました。
sen.e: "Yukyo Taiheiki" directed by Masahiro MAKINO (under the name of Sueroku MAKI), whose filming was under way, was completed by Makino's personal funds, and the planning department manager Matsuyama sold the distribution right of "Hatamoto Goninotoko, Oedo no Tobi" directed by Nobuo NAKAGAWA in Tokyo to pay retirement allowance.

sen.j: また『瀧の白糸』の譲渡金も従業員の退職金に引き当てた。
sen.e: Also, cash gained by selling "Taki no Shiraito" was reserved for employees' retirement allowance.
Also, cash gained by selling "Taki no Shiraito" was reserved for employees' retirement allowance.
Also, cash gained by selling "Taki no Shiraito" was reserved for employees' retirement allowance.

sen.j: そのころ京都駅に戻ってきた笹井とマキノとの密談で、同年4月の同社解散を決めた。
sen.e: Around that time, Sasai who returned to Kyoto and Makino had a secret meeting and they decided to liquidate the company in April of the same year.
Around that time, Sasai who returned to Kyoto and Makino had a secret meeting and they decided to liquidate the company in April of the same year.
Around that time, Sasai who returned to Kyoto and Makino had a secret meeting and they decided to liquidate the company in April of the same year.

sen.j: 監督部の久保為義はJ.Oスタヂオへ、松田定次、広瀬五郎、姓丸浩、宮城文夫は永田雅一所長率いる新興キネマ京都撮影所へ、技術部も新興キネマへ移籍した。
sen.e: Tameyoshi KUBO of directors' department was transferred to J.O Studio, Sadatsugu MATSUDA, Goro HIROSE, Hiroshi SEIMARU and Fumio MIYAGI were transferred to Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio led by Masaichi NAGATA, and the members of technical department were also transferred to Shinko Kinema.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Tameyoshi KUBO of directors' department was transferred to J.O Studio, Sadatsugu MATSUDA, Goro HIROSE, Hiroshi SEIMARU and Fumio MIYAGI were transferred to Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio led by Masaichi NAGATA, and the members of technical department were also transferred to Shinko Kinema.

Tameyoshi KUBO of directors' department was transferred to J.O Studio, Sadatsugu MATSUDA, Goro HIROSE, Hiroshi SEIMARU and Fumio MIYAGI were transferred to Shinko Kinema Kyoto Studio led by Masaichi NAGATA, and the members of technical department were also transferred to Shinko Kinema.

sen.j: ただ、大森伊八カメラマンはもともといた映音へ戻った。
sen.e: However, Ihachi OMORI, a cameraman, returned to Eion to which he previously belonged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, Ihachi OMORI, a cameraman, returned to Eion to which he previously belonged.
However, Ihachi OMORI, a cameraman, returned to Eion to which he previously belonged.

sen.j: 技芸部（俳優）は、トーキーに通用する役者たちなので引く手はあまたであった。
sen.e: Players belonged to the Gigeibu (players) were very much in demand since they could play in talkie films.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理 技芸部→定訳不明
sen.e: Players belonged to the Gigeibu (players) were very much in demand since they could play in talkie films.
Players belonged to the Gigeibu (players) were very much in demand since they could play in talkie films.

sen.j: 葉山純之輔、大内弘ら大半は新興キネマへ、澤村國太郎、光岡龍三郎、そして第二次入社組の水原洋一、田村邦男、團徳麿、志村喬、大倉千代子、大久保清子らは日活へ行くことになる。
sen.e: Most of them, including Junnosuke HAYAMA and Hiroshi OUCHI, were transferred to Shinko Kinema, and Kunitaro SAWAMURA, Ryuzaburo MITSUOKA, Yoichi MIZUHARA, Kunio TAMURA, Tokuma DAN, Takashi SHIMURA, Chiyoko OKURA and Kiyoko OKUBO were transferred to Nikkatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Most of them, including Junnosuke HAYAMA and Hiroshi OUCHI, were transferred to Shinko Kinema, and Kunitaro SAWAMURA, Ryuzaburo MITSUOKA, Yoichi MIZUHARA, Kunio TAMURA, Tokuma DAN, Takashi SHIMURA, Chiyoko OKURA and Kiyoko OKUBO were transferred to Nikkatsu.

Most of them, including Junnosuke HAYAMA and Hiroshi OUCHI, were transferred to Shinko Kinema, and Kunitaro SAWAMURA, Ryuzaburo MITSUOKA, Yoichi MIZUHARA, Kunio TAMURA, Tokuma DAN, Takashi SHIMURA, Chiyoko OKURA and Kiyoko OKUBO were transferred to Nikkatsu.

sen.j: 同年4月の初めの夕刻、撮影所内の通称「マキノトーキー広場」で解散式を行った。
sen.e: A farewell ceremony was held in the evening of a day in early April at commonly-called "Makino Talkie Square" located in the studio.
A farewell ceremony was held in the evening of a day in early April at commonly-called 'Makino Talkie Square' located in the studio.
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: A farewell ceremony was held in the evening of a day in early April at commonly-called 'Makino Talkie Square' located in the studio.

sen.j: 解散式には月形龍之介も現れた。
sen.e: Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA participated in the ceremony.
Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA participated in the ceremony, too.
sen.cmt: 「も」訳漏れのため、文末に, too. を追記して対応しました。
sen.e: Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA participated in the ceremony, too.

sen.j: 同社の看板を火に投じ、樽酒を飲み干し、『マキノトーキー社歌』を歌った。
sen.e: Participants threw the company's signboard into fire, drank cask sake and sang "the company song of Makino Talkie".
Participants threw the company's signboard into fire, drank cask sake and sang "the company song of Makino Talkie."
sen.cmt: ピリオドをコーテーション内に移動しました。
sen.e: Participants threw the company's signboard into fire, drank cask sake and sang "the company song of Makino Talkie."

sen.j: この時点で『遊侠太平記』は未完成であり、完成後の同年8月5日、日活京都撮影所作品として公開された。
sen.e: Although "Yukyo Taihiki" was not completed at the time, it was released on the August 5th of the same year as the film of Nikkatsu Kyoto Studio.
Although "Yukyo Taihiki" was not completed at the time, it was released on August 5 of the same year as the film of Nikkatsu Kyoto Studio.
sen.cmt: on the August 5th を on August 5 に修正しました。
sen.e: Although "Yukyo Taihiki" was not completed at the time, it was released on August 5 of the same year as the film of Nikkatsu Kyoto Studio.

sen.j: マキノは、比佐芳武の書いた吉川英治原作の『恋山彦』の脚本を手に、再び横田更迭後の日活に入社した。
sen.e: Makino rejoined Nikkatsu, which had already replaced Yokota, bringing a scenario which was adapted by Yoshitake HISA based on Eiji YOSHIKAWA's "Koi Yamahiko".
Makino rejoined Nikkatsu, which had already replaced Yokota, with a scenario written by Yoshitake HISA based on Eiji YOSHIKAWA's "Koi Yamahiko."
sen.cmt: 後半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Makino rejoined Nikkatsu, which had already replaced Yokota, with a scenario written by Yoshitake HISA based on Eiji YOSHIKAWA's "Koi Yamahiko."

sen.j: 松竹から阪東妻三郎を譲り受け、入社第1作として阪東主演で『恋山彦 風雲の巻』を監督した。
sen.e: After getting Tsumasaburo BANDO from Shochiku, he directed "Koi Yamahiko Fuun no maki" with Bando being a leading actor as his first film at Nikkatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After getting Tsumasaburo BANDO from Shochiku, he directed "Koi Yamahiko Fuun no maki" with Bando being a leading actor as his first film at Nikkatsu.
After getting Tsumasaburo BANDO from Shochiku, he directed "Koi Yamahiko Fuun no maki" with Bando being a leading actor as his first film at Nikkatsu.

sen.j: また千恵プロを解散した片岡千恵蔵や元マキノトーキーの志村喬らとミュージカル映画『鴛鴦歌合戦』（1939年）を監督するのはこの後の話である。
sen.e: He later directed a musical film "Oshidori Utagassen" (1930) together with Chiezo KATAOKA, who had liquidated Kataoka Production, and Takashi Shimura, who had belonged to Makino Talkie.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He later directed a musical film "Oshidori Utagassen" (1930) together with Chiezo KATAOKA, who had liquidated Kataoka Production, and Takashi SHIMURA, who had belonged to Makino Talkie.
sen.cmt: Shimura を SHIMURA に修正しました。
sen.e: He later directed a musical film "Oshidori Utagassen" (1930) together with Chiezo KATAOKA, who had liquidated Kataoka Production, and Takashi SHIMURA, who had belonged to Makino Talkie.

sen.j: トーキー設備をもつマキノトーキー撮影所は、「甲陽映画」から独立した今井理輔の「今井映画製作所」となった。
sen.e: Makino Talkie Studio, which had facilities to produce talkie films, was acquired by Risuke IMAI, who had become independent from "Koyo Eiga", and became "Imai Eiga Seisakusho".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Makino Talkie Studio with facilities to produce talkie films became 'Imai Eiga Seisakusho' of Risuke IMAI, who had become independent from 'Koyo Eiga.'
Makino Talkie Studio with facilities to produce talkie films became 'Imai Eiga Seisakusho' of Risuke IMAI, who had become independent from 'Koyo Eiga.'

sen.j: 22本を製作したが、同社も翌1938年（昭和13年）春には解散した。
sen.e: The above company produced 22 films, but it was also liquidated in 1938.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The above company produced 22 films, but it was also liquidated in the spring of 1938.
sen.cmt: 「春には」訳漏れのためthe spring of を追記して対応しました。
sen.e: The above company produced 22 films, but it was also liquidated in the spring of 1938.

sen.j: 同撮影所はのちに松竹京都撮影所となった。
sen.e: The studio later became Shochiku Kyoto Studio.
The studio later became Shochiku Kyoto Studio.
The studio later became Shochiku Kyoto Studio.

sen.j: 新興キネマに行ったはずの広瀬五郎は今井映画で4本撮っており、東宝京都撮影所に行った中川信夫も1本シナリオを書いている。
sen.e: Goro HIROSE, who was once transferred to Shinko Kinema, produced four films at Imai Eiga, and Nobuo NAKAGAWA, who was transferred to Toho Kyoto Studio, wrote a piece of scenario.
Goro HIROSE, who was once transferred to Shinko Kinema, produced four films at Imai Eiga, and Nobuo NAKAGAWA, who was transferred to Toho Kyoto Studio, wrote a piece of scenario.
Goro HIROSE, who was once transferred to Shinko Kinema, produced four films at Imai Eiga, and Nobuo NAKAGAWA, who was transferred to Toho Kyoto Studio, wrote a piece of scenario.
